headline: Their Shoes — A Game of Perspective
description: A civic exercise in disciplined empathy and honest disagreement. 'Their Shoes' is designed to restore the art of dialogue by teaching participants to argue from conviction, reverse positions in good faith, and integrate understanding without surrendering integrity.
author: Aleksandr (Agnitio)
whyItMatters: ‘Their Shoes’ redefines debate as a moral rehearsal. Rather than seeking victory, it transforms disagreement into civic empathy training. Each inversion of stance becomes a miniature moral pilgrimage — an experiment in perceiving truth through another’s eyes without dissolving one’s own. It is a bridge between rhetoric and conscience.

motifMap.meaning: Empathy through embodiment — walking in another’s stance

articleExcerpt: A structured debate game to strengthen empathy, composure, and moral imagination — training the civic soul through disciplined disagreement.

sourceFragments.title: Their Shoes — A Game of Perspective
sourceFragments.excerpt: Two participants take turns defending their own beliefs, inhabiting the opposing side, and then integrating what they have learned. The project’s goal is not consensus but perspective literacy — the ability to see through another’s eyes without surrendering one’s own integrity.
